result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge and restitution surcharge FORTHWITH convert to a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all court costs due to imposition of DNA surcharge and restitution.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  1  YEAR in the House of Corrections straight time with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1000.00 to Lahoma G.
Defendant to pay DNA surcharges 
Court waived all court costs due to imposition of DNA surcharges and restitution.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
Restitution and DNA surcharges to be paid forthwith to convert to a civil judgement.

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Plea date scheduled for 10-14-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson, appearing for Thomas Potter, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case returned from Branch 6.
Court orders case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 19.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.
Case not to be resolved globally with 15CF3439.  Case is being transferred back to br. 19.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Renden informs the court that the defendant has a new felony charge in Branch 6.  Branch 19 allows Branch 6 to resolve this case.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 6.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court previously issued a warrant for the defendant's non-appearance.  Defendant is present, warrant is withdrawn.  Defense requests plea hearing date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Ronald Dague on behalf of Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond that was previously signed to remain.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-03-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dale Sonterrius Hall in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/24/15 @ 1:30pm
